prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: USS1558 Band-7 observation with C36-5 (0.14 arcsec)
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: A study to spatially resolve dust-obscured SF activity of CO-detected gas-rich major merging galaxies in the core of proto-cluster environment at z=2.5. In this SG, we aim to observe with high-resolution mode (with Band-7 C36-5 configuration) to identify ~kpc clumps within the galaxies.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: This is a single continuum observation, and so the default setup is fine.

The requested angular resolution of 0.14" is comparable to the image quality of our HST (ACS/WFC3) data available in the USS1558 field, and also comparable to the typical size of star-forming clumps. Therefore we believe that this angular resolution would be the best choice for identifying dense/compact ~kpc-scale clumps. We note that we may miss a fraction of their flux due to the contribution from diffuse components with the high-resolution configuration alone. In order to recover the total flux, and to quantify the contribution of clumps to the total IR luminosity, we also request observation with poorer spatial resolution (1.0") in another SG.

We will perform 5 pointing with Band-7 (345GHz) to detect dust continuum emission of gas-rich major merting galaxies as well as the surrounding H-alpha emitters in the USS1558 proto-cluster field. We estimate the total IR luminosity of the merging galaxies from MIPS 24um and JVLA radio continuum data and their estimated flux density at Band-7 is ~1.5 mJy. Assuming that this will be resolved into ~5 clumps, we need to detect each clump (with ~0.3mJy) with S/N>5. Therefore we request RMS level of 0.06 mJy, which can be achieved with 11.1-min on-source integration according to the ALMA sensitivity calculator. The goal of this proposal is to identify the most luminous dusty clumps (rather than complete mapping of diffuse components), and we expect this estimate is reasonable. We note that we request the same RMS level for the other H-alpha emitters: they are fainter than merging galaxies (based on their H-alpha luminosity and typical dust extinction correction), but assuming they will be resolved into ~3 clumps, we can assume the same flux level per beam.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: Copy of USS1558 Band-7 observation with C36-1 (1.0 arcsec)
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: A study to spatially resolve dust-obscured SF activity of CO-detected gas-rich major merging galaxies in the core of proto-cluster environment at z=2.5. In this SG, we aim to observe with high-resolution mode (with Band-7 C36-1 configuration) to recover total flux of the galaxies.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: This is a single continuum observation, and so the default setup is fine.

The requested angular resolution of 1.0" in this SG is set to recover total flux (rather than spatially resolving the galaxies into kpc-scale clumps). This is important to measure missing flux due to the high-resolution configuration.

We will perform 5 pointing with Band-7 (345GHz) to detect dust continuum emission of gas-rich major merting galaxies as well as the surrounding H-alpha emitters in the USS1558 proto-cluster field. We estimate the total IR luminosity of the merging galaxies from MIPS 24um and JVLA radio continuum data and their estimated flux density at Band-7 is ~1.5 mJy. To measure their flux with reasonable S/N (>~10), we request RMS level of 0.14 mJy, which can be achieved with 2.0-min on-source integration according to the ALMA sensitivity calculator. We note that we do not intend to spatially resolve dust emission from individual galaxies in this SG, but this is important to understand the missing flux (due to the diffuse components) with the high-resolution configuration. We note that the other H-alpha emitters are fainter (by a factor of ~2x), but still we can achieve S/N~5 with the same RMS level.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: Our recent Jansky Very Large Array (JVLA) observation of a newly discovered z=2.53 proto-cluster environment successfully discovered CO(J=1-0) detections from two H-alpha emitting galaxies residing in the very central core of the proto-cluster. This is the first direct evidence of gas-rich major mergers taking place in young cluster environments at z>2. We therefore propose ALMA/Band-7 observations to perform an extensive, high spatial resolution study of dusty star-formation (SF) activity in the central part of the cluster. The main goal of this proposal is to spatially resolve the dust-enshrouded SF activity within the CO-detected, gas-rich major merging galaxies. By comparing our HST/ACS (rest-UV) and HST/WFC3 (rest-optical) data, we will determine if the gas-rich merger galaxies can really boost the SF activity of the central core part of the galaxies, or they are forming stars over the galaxies.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:relatedProposals: 2015.1.00395 (PI: Kodama): CO(J=3-2) observation of the same target - providing a complementary data
prp:ObsProposal.prp:scientificCategoryString: Cosmology and the High Redshift Universe
